wikipedia_page.main: John Henry Birtles (1874 – 4 February 1935) was a British rugby union player who competed in the 1900 Summer Olympics. He was a member of the British rugby union team, which won the silver medal.

link_mentions.page: Rugby union at the 1900 Summer Olympics
response: Britain actually outscored France in the second half, 8–6, but had little chance of catching up. Joseph Wallis scored a try while J. Henry Birtles made a conversion and a penalty for Britain. Reichel scored his second try of the tournament, and Léon Binoche added a try to bring France's victory to a 27–8 margin.October 28, 1900 on Rugby Football History
